September 18: Barcelona already has its first cycling map

The study is the result of a collaboration between the Institute of Environmental Science and Technology (ICTA-UAB) the Barcelona Supercomputing Center (BSC-CNS) and the Bicycle Club of Catalonia (BACC), with the fundamental support of the public: 43 volunteers collected data through the BiciZen platform, making a more detailed and possible model possible.

It is an innovative tool that allows estimating cycling traffic in more than 20,000 road sections of the city and that opens the door to a much more accurate understanding of cycling mobility patterns.

This information is key to the management of mobility in the city, since for the first time we have a detailed x-ray of cycling flows at street level. In addition, one of the great lessons learned from the project is that citizen participation has been decisive in improving the models: without crowdsourcing, today we would not have such a fine-tuned and representative map of the cycling reality.

Source: Company Website

September 17: The UAB to hold European Research Night with a full informative activities session

On Friday 26 September the UAB will celebrate European Research Night with a day full of informative activities. The aim is to bring research, innovation, and their protagonists closer to audiences of all ages in a simple and fun way. Starting at 5:00 p.m., the Universitat Autonoma de Barcelona will host a research fair featuring workshops and exhibitions, games, and mini-lectures with researchers from the university and research institutes from the UAB Sphere.

The event is held each year on the last Friday of September in more than 300 cities in 30 European countries simultaneously. During the week of 22 to 26 September, more than 200 activities will be offered in Catalonia, free of charge and for all audiences, including talks, workshops, experiments, shows, and games, with the participation of researchers from more than 50 scientific institutions.

Source: Company Website

September 17: Autonomous University of Barcelona One more person from Palestine benefits from the #UABRefugi grants

A PhD student from Palestine will join the UAB in the 2025/26 academic year thanks to the #UABRefugi grants. The grants represent a comprehensive support model for refugees and now has been reinforced with a special fund to assist university students currently suffering from the armed conflict and genocide being committed by the Israeli state against the Palestinian population. A total of five people have already benefited from this aid.

The UAB programme is a comprehensive support model since the grants cover not only academic expenses, but also other costs related to materials and transport. The UAB also provides support to refugees, such as in the case of the new PhD student arriving from Palestine and his family, in terms of housing, either by reserving places at the Vila Universitaria or by working in coordination with the municipalities surrounding the campus. In addition, the UAB will launch a crowdfunding campaign among the university community to obtain new resources to support extra-academic needs such as legal advice, document translation, etc.

Source: Company Website

September 17: Autonomous University of Barcelona La Comunitaria to mark the start of the new academic year once again

On Tuesday 30 September, The Community returns for a new fall edition, from 12:00 noon to 4:00 p.m. The Bellaterra campus will host activities, shows, experiences, and much more. The event is an opportunity to get to know the UAB's network of associations, learn, and enjoy a unique day.

The opening speech, in the Placa del Coneixement, will kick off the 2025 fall edition of La Comunitaria. And once the day begins, attendees will be able to enjoy the entites' fair which offers a wide range of activities organised by the different groups, student councils, and services that form part of the University and enrich the UAB.

In addition, Placa del Coneixement will host various shows and performances, such as the traditional human towers by the Ganapies and sardana dancing by the Agrupacio Sardanista de Cerdanyola del Valles. It should be noted that this year's event coincides with the 25th anniversary of the UAB Solidarity Foundation (FAS), with activities to commemorate the anniversary.

Source: Company Website

September 17: Twelve UAB projects selected to study and improve emotional wellbeing at universities

Twelve UAB research projects have been selected by AGAUR in a second call for the development of projects with social impacts. The projects must take on challenges related to mental health and emotional wellbeing at universities and other entities of the research and innovation system.

The selected projects cover disciplines such as clinical and health psychology, veterinary medicine, physics, nursing, social psychology, and anthropology, and will address different subjects of study. The aim is to obtain data and provide solutions for the emotional wellbeing of all members of the university community, which in turn can be extrapolated and sustained over time. The total amount obtained to conduct these studies is EUR220,000.

All selected studies will be carried out in coordination between the research groups involved, with the collaboration of the UAB's CORE in Mental Health network and the Equality and Diversity Service. The main project will be carried out by the Equality and Diversity Service, under the title "Recursos per a la promocio del benestar emocional i l'autocura per a la comunitat de la UAB: sensibilitzacio, punts blaus i grups d'ajuda mutua" [Resources for promoting emotional wellbeing and self-care for the UAB community: awareness-raising, blue points, and mutual support groups].

September 10: Autonomous University of Barcelona: R7 Cercanias abolition from November 2025 to May 2026

The works at the Montcada Bifurcacio station will involve the removal of the R7 line for 7 months. 100925_Supressio R7

The works being carried out by Adif in Montcada i Reixac will affect the service of the R2 Norte, R2 Sur, R7, and R11 commuter train lines. The remodeling of the tracks and the installation of a new traffic management system will mean the elimination of the R7 line between November 2, 2025, and May 15, 2026.

To guarantee the right to mobility, Renfe will offer an alternative bus service between the Cerdanyola stations, which can still be reached by the R4 line, and the Campus.

The schedules for this service and the exact stop locations will be available in the coming weeks.

Source: Company Website

September 10: The third training programme for UAB staff in 2025 includes more than 110 activities

The UAB has published its third continuing education programme for 2025, aimed at both teaching and research staff (PDI) and technical, management, administrative, and service staff (PTGAS). This new programme includes more than 110 training activities that can be completed until 30 January 2026. The deadline for submitting applications is 19 September. Young man working on the computer Young man working on the computer

The programmes offered have been designed to meet the professional needs of both teaching and research staff and administrative and technical staff, with a wide variety of topics, formats, and schedules (to facilitate work-life balance, afternoon training and asynchronous virtual modalities are included). Some activities are aimed at both groups, such as those related to gender perspective, digital skills, occupational risk prevention, and research projects. These common lines respond to cross-cutting areas of institutional and professional development.

Source: Company Website

September 10: Autonomous University of Barcelona: One billion euros for the technological transformation of the Alba Synchrotron

The Government of Catalonia and the Spanish Ministry for Science, Innovation, and Universities have signed an agreement establishing a joint contribution of nearly one billion euros until 2038 to transform the Alba Synchrotron into a fourth-generation synchrotron light infrastructure. The agreement was presented at an institutional event attended by UAB Rector Javier Lafuente. Sincrotro Alba

Diana Mirant, minister for Science, Innovation, and Universities, and Salvador Illa, president of the Government of Catalonia, recently signed an agreement establishing a joint contribution of over EUR926 million over the 2025-2038 period to transform the Alba Synchrotron into a fourth-generation synchrotron light infrastructure. The total contributions made by the Catalan government will amount to almost EUR465 million over the agreed period. The Ministry Spanish for Science, Innovation, and Universities has committed to spending EUR461 million.

Source: Company Website

urn:contentItem:6GT5-JR03-RSXG-T24S-00000-00Updated: September 10, 2025: The third training programme for UAB staff in 2025 includes more than 110 activities and other recent news2025-09-22T00:00:00Z2025-11-15T07:40:49ZLexisNexisANNOUNCEMENTSUpdated: September 10, 2025: The third training programme for UAB staff in 2025 includes more than 110 activities and other recent news

The UAB has published its third continuing education programme for 2025, aimed at both teaching and research staff (PDI) and technical, management, administrative, and service staff (PTGAS). This new programme includes more than 110 training activities that can be completed until 30 January 2026. The deadline for submitting applications is 19 September. Young man working on the computer Young man working on the computer

The programmes offered have been designed to meet the professional needs of both teaching and research staff and administrative and technical staff, with a wide variety of topics, formats, and schedules (to facilitate work-life balance, afternoon training and asynchronous virtual modalities are included). Some activities are aimed at both groups, such as those related to gender perspective, digital skills, occupational risk prevention, and research projects. These common lines respond to cross-cutting areas of institutional and professional development.

INDEX

SECTION 1 PRESS RELEASES: 2025

SECTION 2 OTHER NEWS: 2025

SECTION 1 PRESS RELEASES: 2025

September 17: The UAB Healthcare Service celebrates its 50th anniversary with a tribute and recognition ceremony

The event, which brought together some one hundred people, was presided by UAB Rector Javier Lafuente, accompanied at the table by Secretary General Esther Zapater, and director of the SAS, Arantza Igartua.

Rector Lafuente welcomed the attendees and emphasised the importance of highlighting the service's track record. Esther Zapater then spoke about the fact that the SAS has been able to adapt to changing times over the course of five decades, incorporating specialties such as gynaecology, dentistry, occupational health and psychology, and demonstrating its ability to respond to critical moments such as the pandemic. The secretary general highlighted the role of proximity and humanity played by the service's staff and also gave thanks to the work carried out by the members of the First Response Teams in Emergency Situations (EPAS), who altruistically and voluntarily assist with first aid in the different UAB centres.

Source: Company Website

SECTION 2 OTHER NEWS: 2025

September 18: Join the October edition of the UAB's virtual fair for Master's Degrees, Graduate Courses and PhD Programmes

Are you looking into master's degrees and graduate courses to continue your training, specialise or reorient your professional career? Have you finished a master's degree and want to continue your academic career with a PhD? Would you like to meet and speak with the coordinator(s) of the programme that interests you? The UAB's Virtual Fair for Master's Degrees, Graduate Courses and PhD Programmes celebrates a new edition so that you can find the answers to all those questions and more. We invite you to check the complete list of sessions and register for all those that are of interest to you.

From Monday 6 to Friday 10 October 2025: five days in a row to be able to receive information about a wide range of official master's degrees, UAB-specific master's degrees, graduate courses and PhD programmes in all areas of knowledge. Around 150 information sessions, each focused on a specific study programme. The sessions consist of a short introduction made by the coordinator(s) of the study programme and then a question and answer session to clear up any doubts you may have.

Source: Company Website

September 18: Autonomous University of Barcelona Horses, possible allies in forest fire prevention

The research-which included the participation of Boumort Wildland, the Miranda Foundation, the Forest Horses association, and the University of Barcelona (UB)-reveals that horses adapt their diet according to breed, environment and use. This flexibility helps them play a complementary role alongside other herbivores in sustainable fire prevention strategies, given that their grazing reduces fuel loads and maintains open landscapes. The study was co-authored by researchers from the Department of Animal and Food Science at the UAB Jordi Bartolome and Araceli Gort-Esteve.

"Until now research on extensive herding and forest fire prevention has focused mainly on sheep and goats, with some isolated studies done on breeds of rustic cattle. There have been very few studies on horses within this context, since traditionally they are classified as plant grazers that have little effect on woody vegetations", explains Ariadna Nieto-Espinet, Ramon y Cajal researcher at the UdL and zooarchaeologist. "Our work is one of the first to use empirical data to analyse their potential in forest management in the Mediterannean", she adds.

Source: Company Website

September 18: Sixty-four internships to explain the UAB to future UABers

If you are a UAB student and want to share your experience with others, this is your chance! We are looking for 64 undergraduate and graduate students interested in explaining the different degrees and services offered at the UAB and solve any doubts future UABers may have.

We offer three different internships, one with 60 places and two more with two places each:

The first is the Promotional activities which consists in 100 hours distributed throughout the months of January and May 2026, and focusing on student participation in activities and events, such as the Education Fair, Open Days, Family Days and other activities, both on-site and online. All of the activities can be found at the #VisitTheUAB website. Students will receive a grant of 746 euros gross in total. A total of 60 placements are offered to students from all faculties and schools, to be able to explain the wide range of academic programmes available at the UAB. You must sign up through Nexus.

September 18: The UAB is sad to announce the death of Josep Llopart

Josep Llopart Barcelo held the position of university manager before continuing his professional career outside the UAB.

The wake will be held at the Molins de Rei funeral home on 18 September until 2:00 p.m. The funeral service will take place at 3:30 p.m. at the Sant Miquel Arcangel church in Molins de Rei on the same day, 18 September.

September 18: Barcelona already has its first cycling map

The study is the result of a collaboration between the Institute of Environmental Science and Technology (ICTA-UAB) the Barcelona Supercomputing Center (BSC-CNS) and the Bicycle Club of Catalonia (BACC), with the fundamental support of the public: 43 volunteers collected data through the BiciZen platform, making a more detailed and possible model possible.

It is an innovative tool that allows estimating cycling traffic in more than 20,000 road sections of the city and that opens the door to a much more accurate understanding of cycling mobility patterns.

This information is key to the management of mobility in the city, since for the first time we have a detailed x-ray of cycling flows at street level. In addition, one of the great lessons learned from the project is that citizen participation has been decisive in improving the models: without crowdsourcing, today we would not have such a fine-tuned and representative map of the cycling reality.

Source: Company Website

September 17: The UAB to hold European Research Night with a full informative activities session

On Friday 26 September the UAB will celebrate European Research Night with a day full of informative activities. The aim is to bring research, innovation, and their protagonists closer to audiences of all ages in a simple and fun way. Starting at 5:00 p.m., the Universitat Autonoma de Barcelona will host a research fair featuring workshops and exhibitions, games, and mini-lectures with researchers from the university and research institutes from the UAB Sphere.

The event is held each year on the last Friday of September in more than 300 cities in 30 European countries simultaneously. During the week of 22 to 26 September, more than 200 activities will be offered in Catalonia, free of charge and for all audiences, including talks, workshops, experiments, shows, and games, with the participation of researchers from more than 50 scientific institutions.

Source: Company Website

September 17: Autonomous University of Barcelona One more person from Palestine benefits from the #UABRefugi grants

A PhD student from Palestine will join the UAB in the 2025/26 academic year thanks to the #UABRefugi grants. The grants represent a comprehensive support model for refugees and now has been reinforced with a special fund to assist university students currently suffering from the armed conflict and genocide being committed by the Israeli state against the Palestinian population. A total of five people have already benefited from this aid.

The UAB programme is a comprehensive support model since the grants cover not only academic expenses, but also other costs related to materials and transport. The UAB also provides support to refugees, such as in the case of the new PhD student arriving from Palestine and his family, in terms of housing, either by reserving places at the Vila Universitaria or by working in coordination with the municipalities surrounding the campus. In addition, the UAB will launch a crowdfunding campaign among the university community to obtain new resources to support extra-academic needs such as legal advice, document translation, etc.

Source: Company Website

September 17: Autonomous University of Barcelona La Comunitaria to mark the start of the new academic year once again

On Tuesday 30 September, The Community returns for a new fall edition, from 12:00 noon to 4:00 p.m. The Bellaterra campus will host activities, shows, experiences, and much more. The event is an opportunity to get to know the UAB's network of associations, learn, and enjoy a unique day.

The opening speech, in the Placa del Coneixement, will kick off the 2025 fall edition of La Comunitaria. And once the day begins, attendees will be able to enjoy the entites' fair which offers a wide range of activities organised by the different groups, student councils, and services that form part of the University and enrich the UAB.

In addition, Placa del Coneixement will host various shows and performances, such as the traditional human towers by the Ganapies and sardana dancing by the Agrupacio Sardanista de Cerdanyola del Valles. It should be noted that this year's event coincides with the 25th anniversary of the UAB Solidarity Foundation (FAS), with activities to commemorate the anniversary.

Source: Company Website

September 17: Twelve UAB projects selected to study and improve emotional wellbeing at universities

Twelve UAB research projects have been selected by AGAUR in a second call for the development of projects with social impacts. The projects must take on challenges related to mental health and emotional wellbeing at universities and other entities of the research and innovation system.

The selected projects cover disciplines such as clinical and health psychology, veterinary medicine, physics, nursing, social psychology, and anthropology, and will address different subjects of study. The aim is to obtain data and provide solutions for the emotional wellbeing of all members of the university community, which in turn can be extrapolated and sustained over time. The total amount obtained to conduct these studies is EUR220,000.

All selected studies will be carried out in coordination between the research groups involved, with the collaboration of the UAB's CORE in Mental Health network and the Equality and Diversity Service. The main project will be carried out by the Equality and Diversity Service, under the title "Recursos per a la promocio del benestar emocional i l'autocura per a la comunitat de la UAB: sensibilitzacio, punts blaus i grups d'ajuda mutua" [Resources for promoting emotional wellbeing and self-care for the UAB community: awareness-raising, blue points, and mutual support groups].

September 10: Autonomous University of Barcelona: R7 Cercanias abolition from November 2025 to May 2026

The works at the Montcada Bifurcacio station will involve the removal of the R7 line for 7 months. 100925_Supressio R7

The works being carried out by Adif in Montcada i Reixac will affect the service of the R2 Norte, R2 Sur, R7, and R11 commuter train lines. The remodeling of the tracks and the installation of a new traffic management system will mean the elimination of the R7 line between November 2, 2025, and May 15, 2026.

To guarantee the right to mobility, Renfe will offer an alternative bus service between the Cerdanyola stations, which can still be reached by the R4 line, and the Campus.

The schedules for this service and the exact stop locations will be available in the coming weeks.

Source: Company Website

September 10: The UAB promotes language learning as a path to more training, research and socialisation

The UAB offers language courses for international students studying at the UAB so that they can become familiar with the Catalan language, and also for UAB students thinking of studying abroad, to learn the language of the country they will visit. Languages are key to opening the doors of both academic learning and research activities, as well as being able to communicate in everyday life situations and understanding the local culture. The similarity among the different Romance languages also makes it easier for those who speak one of these languages, to quickly learn to speak another one. La UAB de les llengues

On the one hand, the Languages Service - UAB Idiomes offers a wide array of courses in many of the languages spoken in the countries where UAB students go to study abroad. These courses help them improve academically and live the university experience abroad to the fullest. Mastering a new language also contributes to creating more research collaborations and advancing towards a science without borders.

Source: Company Website

September 10: Autonomous University of Barcelona: One billion euros for the technological transformation of the Alba Synchrotron

The Government of Catalonia and the Spanish Ministry for Science, Innovation, and Universities have signed an agreement establishing a joint contribution of nearly one billion euros until 2038 to transform the Alba Synchrotron into a fourth-generation synchrotron light infrastructure. The agreement was presented at an institutional event attended by UAB Rector Javier Lafuente. Sincrotro Alba

Diana Mirant, minister for Science, Innovation, and Universities, and Salvador Illa, president of the Government of Catalonia, recently signed an agreement establishing a joint contribution of over EUR926 million over the 2025-2038 period to transform the Alba Synchrotron into a fourth-generation synchrotron light infrastructure. The total contributions made by the Catalan government will amount to almost EUR465 million over the agreed period. The Ministry Spanish for Science, Innovation, and Universities has committed to spending EUR461 million.

Source: Company Website

urn:contentItem:6GTT-G873-RT4H-X1SD-00000-00Updated: September 18, 2025: The UAB brings together leading experts in space communications in Barcelona and other recent news2025-09-25T00:00:00Z2025-11-15T07:40:49ZLexisNexisANNOUNCEMENTSUpdated: September 18, 2025: The UAB brings together leading experts in space communications in Barcelona and other recent news

On 22 and 23 September, Casa Convalescencia UAB will host the Satellite Network of Experts V Seasonal School, with the participation of leading experts in satellite and space communications such as Holly Ridings from NASA and Oana Graur from ESA. Satellits

The Quantum Communication and Secure Information (Q-CSI) research group, from the Department of Telecommunications and Systems Engineering at the UAB, organises the EURASIP Satellite Network of Experts V Seasonal School, a project of the European Space Agency (ESA) within the framework of the Connectivity and Secure Communications (CSC) department, co-organised by the Institute of Space Studies of Catalonia (IEEC).

The school is aimed at early-stage researchers and industry professionals, PhD students, and postdoctoral researchers interested in exploring the latest advances in satellite and space communications. It will take place on 22 and 23 Septemeber at Casa Convalescencia UAB and is organised in conjunction with the International Conference on Satellite Systems Communications (ICSSC 2025) of the American Institute of Aeronautics and Astronautics (AIAA), which will take place from 23 to 25 September.

September 22: Events Calendar: The UAB to host the First Artistic Heritage Campus Research Conference

On 2 October the Periodicals Room of the Humanities Library, located in the Faculty of Arts & Humanities, will host the First Artistic Heritage Campus Research Conference, a meeting aimed at strengthening ties between the academic world and museum and heritage institutions. Imatge del cartell de la I Jornada del Campus de Patrimoni Artistic de la UAB

The main goal of the conference is to promote synergies between the University and the organisations making up this network, inviting participating institutions to present their ongoing research projects and propose new lines of research related to the collections, which could be developed in the final degree projects (TFG) and final master theses (TFM) of the studies linked to the Campus.

Source: Company Website

September 17: The UAB Healthcare Service celebrates its 50th anniversary with a tribute and recognition ceremony

The event, which brought together some one hundred people, was presided by UAB Rector Javier Lafuente, accompanied at the table by Secretary General Esther Zapater, and director of the SAS, Arantza Igartua.

Rector Lafuente welcomed the attendees and emphasised the importance of highlighting the service's track record. Esther Zapater then spoke about the fact that the SAS has been able to adapt to changing times over the course of five decades, incorporating specialties such as gynaecology, dentistry, occupational health and psychology, and demonstrating its ability to respond to critical moments such as the pandemic. The secretary general highlighted the role of proximity and humanity played by the service's staff and also gave thanks to the work carried out by the members of the First Response Teams in Emergency Situations (EPAS), who altruistically and voluntarily assist with first aid in the different UAB centres.

Source: Company Website

September 22: Autonomous University of Barcelona: Flu vaccination campaign begins

From 13 October to 10 December, the UAB Healthcare Service will be running a flu vaccination campaign for the entire university community. vacunaciogrip2017

From 13 October to 10 December, the university community will be able to receive the flu vaccine administered by the UAB Healthcare Service. The vaccination campaign is available to the entire university community, especially those at high risk of complications related to the flu.

September 19: Autonomous University of Barcelona First case of betanodavirus infection in a grouper confirmed in Catalonia in 2025

On 7 September a specimen of grouper (Epinephelus marginatus) was detected in waters near Barcelona with clear symptoms consistent with betanodavirus infection, also known as viral nervous necrosis (VNN). The discovery was made possible thanks to a report from a member of the Barcelona Underwater Fishing Association (APS), who sent the specimen to the Fish Pathology Diagnostic Service at the Universitat Autonoma de Barcelona (UAB). Samples of the fish were then sent to the European reference laboratory for this disease, where molecular techniques (qPCR) confirmed a very high presence of the virus in the animal's brain.

This identification, together with other reports of dead or symptomatic groupers, unequivocally confirms the spread of VNN and its presence in the coastal waters of Catalonia. For several years now, this betanodavirus has been causing outbreaks of mortality in groupers and other fish species throughout the Mediterranean, with particularly severe outbreaks in Greece, southern Italy, Spain, and recently in the Azores. In Spain, this virus had already caused outbreaks in the Balearic Islands, and a few years ago outbreaks were detected on the coast of the peninsula, with a progressive advance northwards causing very significant mortality of groupers in nature reserves such as Cabrera and Columbretes.

September 19: More intercity buses to take you to the UAB

This year, the intercity bus routes connecting with the UAB will add almost 90 new departures. This affects the Barcelona-Cerdanyola-UAB, Sabadell-Barbera-Badia-UAB, Mataro-Argentona-UAB, Igualada-Martorell-UAB, and Montcada-Ripollet-UAB lines. These improvements are part of the Intercity Bus Emergency Plan, which receives an investment of EUR17 million. Bus a l'eix central de la UAB

On 19 September, UAB Rector Javier Lafuente was accompanied by Xavier Gabarrell, vice-rector for Campus and Sustainability, and Manel Nadal, secretary for Mobility and Infrastructure of the Government of Catalonia, at the presentation of the improvements for this 2025/26 academic year, which included almost 90 new departures of several intercity buses connecting the nearby towns with the UAB.

Thanks to citizen collaboration, on 7 September a grouper with symptoms of betanodavirus infection was detected in waters near Barcelona, diagnosed by the UAB Fish Pathology Diagnostic Service. For several years, the virus has been causing outbreaks of mortality in groupers and other fish species throughout the Mediterranean. The UAB and the Institute of Marine Sciences (ICM-CSIC) have set up an alert and sample collection network to identify cases and monitor the evolution of the disease. Mero

On 7 September a specimen of grouper (Epinephelus marginatus) was detected in waters near Barcelona with clear symptoms consistent with betanodavirus infection, also known as viral nervous necrosis (VNN). The discovery was made possible thanks to a report from a member of the Barcelona Underwater Fishing Association (APS), who sent the specimen to the Fish Pathology Diagnostic Service at the Universitat Autonoma de Barcelona (UAB). Samples of the fish were then sent to the European reference laboratory for this disease, where molecular techniques (qPCR) confirmed a very high presence of the virus in the animal's brain.

September 18: Autonomous University of Barcelona Horses, possible allies in forest fire prevention

The research-which included the participation of Boumort Wildland, the Miranda Foundation, the Forest Horses association, and the University of Barcelona (UB)-reveals that horses adapt their diet according to breed, environment and use. This flexibility helps them play a complementary role alongside other herbivores in sustainable fire prevention strategies, given that their grazing reduces fuel loads and maintains open landscapes. The study was co-authored by researchers from the Department of Animal and Food Science at the UAB Jordi Bartolome and Araceli Gort-Esteve.

"Until now research on extensive herding and forest fire prevention has focused mainly on sheep and goats, with some isolated studies done on breeds of rustic cattle. There have been very few studies on horses within this context, since traditionally they are classified as plant grazers that have little effect on woody vegetations", explains Ariadna Nieto-Espinet, Ramon y Cajal researcher at the UdL and zooarchaeologist. "Our work is one of the first to use empirical data to analyse their potential in forest management in the Mediterannean", she adds.

Source: Company Website

September 18: Join the October edition of the UAB's virtual fair for Master's Degrees, Graduate Courses and PhD Programmes

Are you looking into master's degrees and graduate courses to continue your training, specialise or reorient your professional career? Have you finished a master's degree and want to continue your academic career with a PhD? Would you like to meet and speak with the coordinator(s) of the programme that interests you? The UAB's Virtual Fair for Master's Degrees, Graduate Courses and PhD Programmes celebrates a new edition so that you can find the answers to all those questions and more. We invite you to check the complete list of sessions and register for all those that are of interest to you.

From Monday 6 to Friday 10 October 2025: five days in a row to be able to receive information about a wide range of official master's degrees, UAB-specific master's degrees, graduate courses and PhD programmes in all areas of knowledge. Around 150 information sessions, each focused on a specific study programme. The sessions consist of a short introduction made by the coordinator(s) of the study programme and then a question and answer session to clear up any doubts you may have.

September 18: Barcelona already has its first cycling map

The study is the result of a collaboration between the Institute of Environmental Science and Technology (ICTA-UAB) the Barcelona Supercomputing Center (BSC-CNS) and the Bicycle Club of Catalonia (BACC), with the fundamental support of the public: 43 volunteers collected data through the BiciZen platform, making a more detailed and possible model possible.

It is an innovative tool that allows estimating cycling traffic in more than 20,000 road sections of the city and that opens the door to a much more accurate understanding of cycling mobility patterns.

This information is key to the management of mobility in the city, since for the first time we have a detailed x-ray of cycling flows at street level. In addition, one of the great lessons learned from the project is that citizen participation has been decisive in improving the models: without crowdsourcing, today we would not have such a fine-tuned and representative map of the cycling reality.

Source: Company Website

September 18: The UAB is sad to announce the death of Josep Llopart

Josep Llopart Barcelo held the position of university manager before continuing his professional career outside the UAB.

The wake will be held at the Molins de Rei funeral home on 18 September until 2:00 p.m. The funeral service will take place at 3:30 p.m. at the Sant Miquel Arcangel church in Molins de Rei on the same day, 18 September.

The UAB extends its heartfelt condolences to those who knew him and expresses its sadness for losing a member of its community.

September 18: Sixty-four internships to explain the UAB to future UABers

If you are a UAB student and want to share your experience with others, this is your chance! We are looking for 64 undergraduate and graduate students interested in explaining the different degrees and services offered at the UAB and solve any doubts future UABers may have.

We offer three different internships, one with 60 places and two more with two places each:

The first is the Promotional activities which consists in 100 hours distributed throughout the months of January and May 2026, and focusing on student participation in activities and events, such as the Education Fair, Open Days, Family Days and other activities, both on-site and online. All of the activities can be found at the #VisitTheUAB website. Students will receive a grant of 746 euros gross in total. A total of 60 placements are offered to students from all faculties and schools, to be able to explain the wide range of academic programmes available at the UAB. You must sign up through Nexus.

September 17: Autonomous University of Barcelona One more person from Palestine benefits from the #UABRefugi grants

A PhD student from Palestine will join the UAB in the 2025/26 academic year thanks to the #UABRefugi grants. The grants represent a comprehensive support model for refugees and now has been reinforced with a special fund to assist university students currently suffering from the armed conflict and genocide being committed by the Israeli state against the Palestinian population. A total of five people have already benefited from this aid.

The UAB programme is a comprehensive support model since the grants cover not only academic expenses, but also other costs related to materials and transport. The UAB also provides support to refugees, such as in the case of the new PhD student arriving from Palestine and his family, in terms of housing, either by reserving places at the Vila Universitaria or by working in coordination with the municipalities surrounding the campus. In addition, the UAB will launch a crowdfunding campaign among the university community to obtain new resources to support extra-academic needs such as legal advice, document translation, etc.

Source: Company Website

September 17: Autonomous University of Barcelona La Comunitaria to mark the start of the new academic year once again

On Tuesday 30 September, The Community returns for a new fall edition, from 12:00 noon to 4:00 p.m. The Bellaterra campus will host activities, shows, experiences, and much more. The event is an opportunity to get to know the UAB's network of associations, learn, and enjoy a unique day.

The opening speech, in the Placa del Coneixement, will kick off the 2025 fall edition of La Comunitaria. And once the day begins, attendees will be able to enjoy the entites' fair which offers a wide range of activities organised by the different groups, student councils, and services that form part of the University and enrich the UAB.

In addition, Placa del Coneixement will host various shows and performances, such as the traditional human towers by the Ganapies and sardana dancing by the Agrupacio Sardanista de Cerdanyola del Valles. It should be noted that this year's event coincides with the 25th anniversary of the UAB Solidarity Foundation (FAS), with activities to commemorate the anniversary.

Source: Company Website

September 17: Twelve UAB projects selected to study and improve emotional wellbeing at universities

Twelve UAB research projects have been selected by AGAUR in a second call for the development of projects with social impacts. The projects must take on challenges related to mental health and emotional wellbeing at universities and other entities of the research and innovation system.

The selected projects cover disciplines such as clinical and health psychology, veterinary medicine, physics, nursing, social psychology, and anthropology, and will address different subjects of study. The aim is to obtain data and provide solutions for the emotional wellbeing of all members of the university community, which in turn can be extrapolated and sustained over time. The total amount obtained to conduct these studies is EUR220,000.

All selected studies will be carried out in coordination between the research groups involved, with the collaboration of the UAB's CORE in Mental Health network and the Equality and Diversity Service. The main project will be carried out by the Equality and Diversity Service, under the title "Recursos per a la promocio del benestar emocional i l'autocura per a la comunitat de la UAB: sensibilitzacio, punts blaus i grups d'ajuda mutua" [Resources for promoting emotional wellbeing and self-care for the UAB community: awareness-raising, blue points, and mutual support groups].

September 17: The UAB to hold European Research Night with a full informative activities session

On Friday 26 September the UAB will celebrate European Research Night with a day full of informative activities. The aim is to bring research, innovation, and their protagonists closer to audiences of all ages in a simple and fun way. Starting at 5:00 p.m., the Universitat Autonoma de Barcelona will host a research fair featuring workshops and exhibitions, games, and mini-lectures with researchers from the university and research institutes from the UAB Sphere.

The event is held each year on the last Friday of September in more than 300 cities in 30 European countries simultaneously. During the week of 22 to 26 September, more than 200 activities will be offered in Catalonia, free of charge and for all audiences, including talks, workshops, experiments, shows, and games, with the participation of researchers from more than 50 scientific institutions.

Source: Company Website

urn:contentItem:6GTT-G873-RT4H-X1SY-00000-00Updated: September 22, 2025: Autonomous University of Barcelona: Flu vaccination campaign begins and other recent news2025-09-25T00:00:00Z2025-11-15T07:40:49ZLexisNexisANNOUNCEMENTSUpdated: September 22, 2025: Autonomous University of Barcelona: Flu vaccination campaign begins and other recent news

From 13 October to 10 December, the UAB Healthcare Service will be running a flu vaccination campaign for the entire university community. vacunaciogrip2017

From 13 October to 10 December, the university community will be able to receive the flu vaccine administered by the UAB Healthcare Service. The vaccination campaign is available to the entire university community, especially those at high risk of complications related to the flu.

SECTION 1 PRESS RELEASES: 2025

September 22: Events Calendar: The UAB to host the First Artistic Heritage Campus Research Conference

On 2 October the Periodicals Room of the Humanities Library, located in the Faculty of Arts & Humanities, will host the First Artistic Heritage Campus Research Conference, a meeting aimed at strengthening ties between the academic world and museum and heritage institutions. Imatge del cartell de la I Jornada del Campus de Patrimoni Artistic de la UAB

The main goal of the conference is to promote synergies between the University and the organisations making up this network, inviting participating institutions to present their ongoing research projects and propose new lines of research related to the collections, which could be developed in the final degree projects (TFG) and final master theses (TFM) of the studies linked to the Campus.

Source: Company Website

September 17: The UAB Healthcare Service celebrates its 50th anniversary with a tribute and recognition ceremony

The event, which brought together some one hundred people, was presided by UAB Rector Javier Lafuente, accompanied at the table by Secretary General Esther Zapater, and director of the SAS, Arantza Igartua.

Rector Lafuente welcomed the attendees and emphasised the importance of highlighting the service's track record. Esther Zapater then spoke about the fact that the SAS has been able to adapt to changing times over the course of five decades, incorporating specialties such as gynaecology, dentistry, occupational health and psychology, and demonstrating its ability to respond to critical moments such as the pandemic. The secretary general highlighted the role of proximity and humanity played by the service's staff and also gave thanks to the work carried out by the members of the First Response Teams in Emergency Situations (EPAS), who altruistically and voluntarily assist with first aid in the different UAB centres.

Source: Company Website

SECTION 2 OTHER NEWS: 2025

September 19: Autonomous University of Barcelona First case of betanodavirus infection in a grouper confirmed in Catalonia in 2025

On 7 September a specimen of grouper (Epinephelus marginatus) was detected in waters near Barcelona with clear symptoms consistent with betanodavirus infection, also known as viral nervous necrosis (VNN). The discovery was made possible thanks to a report from a member of the Barcelona Underwater Fishing Association (APS), who sent the specimen to the Fish Pathology Diagnostic Service at the Universitat Autonoma de Barcelona (UAB). Samples of the fish were then sent to the European reference laboratory for this disease, where molecular techniques (qPCR) confirmed a very high presence of the virus in the animal's brain.

This identification, together with other reports of dead or symptomatic groupers, unequivocally confirms the spread of VNN and its presence in the coastal waters of Catalonia. For several years now, this betanodavirus has been causing outbreaks of mortality in groupers and other fish species throughout the Mediterranean, with particularly severe outbreaks in Greece, southern Italy, Spain, and recently in the Azores. In Spain, this virus had already caused outbreaks in the Balearic Islands, and a few years ago outbreaks were detected on the coast of the peninsula, with a progressive advance northwards causing very significant mortality of groupers in nature reserves such as Cabrera and Columbretes.

September 19: More intercity buses to take you to the UAB

This year, the intercity bus routes connecting with the UAB will add almost 90 new departures. This affects the Barcelona-Cerdanyola-UAB, Sabadell-Barbera-Badia-UAB, Mataro-Argentona-UAB, Igualada-Martorell-UAB, and Montcada-Ripollet-UAB lines. These improvements are part of the Intercity Bus Emergency Plan, which receives an investment of EUR17 million. Bus a l'eix central de la UAB

On 19 September, UAB Rector Javier Lafuente was accompanied by Xavier Gabarrell, vice-rector for Campus and Sustainability, and Manel Nadal, secretary for Mobility and Infrastructure of the Government of Catalonia, at the presentation of the improvements for this 2025/26 academic year, which included almost 90 new departures of several intercity buses connecting the nearby towns with the UAB.

Source: Company Website

September 19: Autonomous University of Barcelona: Sign up and join a university volunteering programme

This new academic year experience the UAB in a different and more enriching manner. The Fundacio Autonoma Solidaria presents its volunteering programme for this year, which includes social, environmental, and health care programmes, with activities in prisons, hospitals, schools and on campus. All of these programmes work for peace, equality, sustainability and global justice. Volunteering is a unique opportunity to meet people, learn, contribute to social transformations, and validate credits. voluntariat FASUAB

The Fundacio Autonoma Solidaria (FAS), an association with over 25 years of experience in university social actions, presents it catalogue of volunteering proposals for this 2025/26 academic year.

All members of the community can take part in university volunteering. Last year, more than 400 people volunteered, a unique initiative at the university with an enormous social value in terms of proximity and a tool for real transformation.

September 19: Autonomous University of Barcelona: First case of betanodavirus infection in a grouper confirmed in Catalonia in 2025

Thanks to citizen collaboration, on 7 September a grouper with symptoms of betanodavirus infection was detected in waters near Barcelona, diagnosed by the UAB Fish Pathology Diagnostic Service. For several years, the virus has been causing outbreaks of mortality in groupers and other fish species throughout the Mediterranean. The UAB and the Institute of Marine Sciences (ICM-CSIC) have set up an alert and sample collection network to identify cases and monitor the evolution of the disease. Mero

On 7 September a specimen of grouper (Epinephelus marginatus) was detected in waters near Barcelona with clear symptoms consistent with betanodavirus infection, also known as viral nervous necrosis (VNN). The discovery was made possible thanks to a report from a member of the Barcelona Underwater Fishing Association (APS), who sent the specimen to the Fish Pathology Diagnostic Service at the Universitat Autonoma de Barcelona (UAB). Samples of the fish were then sent to the European reference laboratory for this disease, where molecular techniques (qPCR) confirmed a very high presence of the virus in the animal's brain.

Procedure for selecting the topic and assigning a tutor Conditions for completion and monitoring Frequently asked questions about the process

September 18: The UAB brings together leading experts in space communications in Barcelona

On 22 and 23 September, Casa Convalescencia UAB will host the Satellite Network of Experts V Seasonal School, with the participation of leading experts in satellite and space communications such as Holly Ridings from NASA and Oana Graur from ESA. Satellits

The Quantum Communication and Secure Information (Q-CSI) research group, from the Department of Telecommunications and Systems Engineering at the UAB, organises the EURASIP Satellite Network of Experts V Seasonal School, a project of the European Space Agency (ESA) within the framework of the Connectivity and Secure Communications (CSC) department, co-organised by the Institute of Space Studies of Catalonia (IEEC).

The school is aimed at early-stage researchers and industry professionals, PhD students, and postdoctoral researchers interested in exploring the latest advances in satellite and space communications. It will take place on 22 and 23 Septemeber at Casa Convalescencia UAB and is organised in conjunction with the International Conference on Satellite Systems Communications (ICSSC 2025) of the American Institute of Aeronautics and Astronautics (AIAA), which will take place from 23 to 25 September.

Source: Company Website

September 18: Autonomous University of Barcelona Horses, possible allies in forest fire prevention

The research-which included the participation of Boumort Wildland, the Miranda Foundation, the Forest Horses association, and the University of Barcelona (UB)-reveals that horses adapt their diet according to breed, environment and use. This flexibility helps them play a complementary role alongside other herbivores in sustainable fire prevention strategies, given that their grazing reduces fuel loads and maintains open landscapes. The study was co-authored by researchers from the Department of Animal and Food Science at the UAB Jordi Bartolome and Araceli Gort-Esteve.

"Until now research on extensive herding and forest fire prevention has focused mainly on sheep and goats, with some isolated studies done on breeds of rustic cattle. There have been very few studies on horses within this context, since traditionally they are classified as plant grazers that have little effect on woody vegetations", explains Ariadna Nieto-Espinet, Ramon y Cajal researcher at the UdL and zooarchaeologist. "Our work is one of the first to use empirical data to analyse their potential in forest management in the Mediterannean", she adds.

Source: Company Website

September 18: Join the October edition of the UAB's virtual fair for Master's Degrees, Graduate Courses and PhD Programmes

Are you looking into master's degrees and graduate courses to continue your training, specialise or reorient your professional career? Have you finished a master's degree and want to continue your academic career with a PhD? Would you like to meet and speak with the coordinator(s) of the programme that interests you? The UAB's Virtual Fair for Master's Degrees, Graduate Courses and PhD Programmes celebrates a new edition so that you can find the answers to all those questions and more. We invite you to check the complete list of sessions and register for all those that are of interest to you.

From Monday 6 to Friday 10 October 2025: five days in a row to be able to receive information about a wide range of official master's degrees, UAB-specific master's degrees, graduate courses and PhD programmes in all areas of knowledge. Around 150 information sessions, each focused on a specific study programme. The sessions consist of a short introduction made by the coordinator(s) of the study programme and then a question and answer session to clear up any doubts you may have.

Source: Company Website

September 18: Barcelona already has its first cycling map

The study is the result of a collaboration between the Institute of Environmental Science and Technology (ICTA-UAB) the Barcelona Supercomputing Center (BSC-CNS) and the Bicycle Club of Catalonia (BACC), with the fundamental support of the public: 43 volunteers collected data through the BiciZen platform, making a more detailed and possible model possible.

It is an innovative tool that allows estimating cycling traffic in more than 20,000 road sections of the city and that opens the door to a much more accurate understanding of cycling mobility patterns.

This information is key to the management of mobility in the city, since for the first time we have a detailed x-ray of cycling flows at street level. In addition, one of the great lessons learned from the project is that citizen participation has been decisive in improving the models: without crowdsourcing, today we would not have such a fine-tuned and representative map of the cycling reality.

Source: Company Website

September 18: The UAB is sad to announce the death of Josep Llopart

Josep Llopart Barcelo held the position of university manager before continuing his professional career outside the UAB.

The wake will be held at the Molins de Rei funeral home on 18 September until 2:00 p.m. The funeral service will take place at 3:30 p.m. at the Sant Miquel Arcangel church in Molins de Rei on the same day, 18 September.

The UAB extends its heartfelt condolences to those who knew him and expresses its sadness for losing a member of its community.

September 18: Sixty-four internships to explain the UAB to future UABers

If you are a UAB student and want to share your experience with others, this is your chance! We are looking for 64 undergraduate and graduate students interested in explaining the different degrees and services offered at the UAB and solve any doubts future UABers may have.

We offer three different internships, one with 60 places and two more with two places each:

The first is the Promotional activities which consists in 100 hours distributed throughout the months of January and May 2026, and focusing on student participation in activities and events, such as the Education Fair, Open Days, Family Days and other activities, both on-site and online. All of the activities can be found at the #VisitTheUAB website. Students will receive a grant of 746 euros gross in total. A total of 60 placements are offered to students from all faculties and schools, to be able to explain the wide range of academic programmes available at the UAB. You must sign up through Nexus.

September 17: Autonomous University of Barcelona One more person from Palestine benefits from the #UABRefugi grants

A PhD student from Palestine will join the UAB in the 2025/26 academic year thanks to the #UABRefugi grants. The grants represent a comprehensive support model for refugees and now has been reinforced with a special fund to assist university students currently suffering from the armed conflict and genocide being committed by the Israeli state against the Palestinian population. A total of five people have already benefited from this aid.

The UAB programme is a comprehensive support model since the grants cover not only academic expenses, but also other costs related to materials and transport. The UAB also provides support to refugees, such as in the case of the new PhD student arriving from Palestine and his family, in terms of housing, either by reserving places at the Vila Universitaria or by working in coordination with the municipalities surrounding the campus. In addition, the UAB will launch a crowdfunding campaign among the university community to obtain new resources to support extra-academic needs such as legal advice, document translation, etc.

Source: Company Website

September 17: Autonomous University of Barcelona La Comunitaria to mark the start of the new academic year once again

On Tuesday 30 September, The Community returns for a new fall edition, from 12:00 noon to 4:00 p.m. The Bellaterra campus will host activities, shows, experiences, and much more. The event is an opportunity to get to know the UAB's network of associations, learn, and enjoy a unique day.

The opening speech, in the Placa del Coneixement, will kick off the 2025 fall edition of La Comunitaria. And once the day begins, attendees will be able to enjoy the entites' fair which offers a wide range of activities organised by the different groups, student councils, and services that form part of the University and enrich the UAB.

In addition, Placa del Coneixement will host various shows and performances, such as the traditional human towers by the Ganapies and sardana dancing by the Agrupacio Sardanista de Cerdanyola del Valles. It should be noted that this year's event coincides with the 25th anniversary of the UAB Solidarity Foundation (FAS), with activities to commemorate the anniversary.

Source: Company Website

September 17: Twelve UAB projects selected to study and improve emotional wellbeing at universities

Twelve UAB research projects have been selected by AGAUR in a second call for the development of projects with social impacts. The projects must take on challenges related to mental health and emotional wellbeing at universities and other entities of the research and innovation system.

The selected projects cover disciplines such as clinical and health psychology, veterinary medicine, physics, nursing, social psychology, and anthropology, and will address different subjects of study. The aim is to obtain data and provide solutions for the emotional wellbeing of all members of the university community, which in turn can be extrapolated and sustained over time. The total amount obtained to conduct these studies is EUR220,000.

All selected studies will be carried out in coordination between the research groups involved, with the collaboration of the UAB's CORE in Mental Health network and the Equality and Diversity Service. The main project will be carried out by the Equality and Diversity Service, under the title "Recursos per a la promocio del benestar emocional i l'autocura per a la comunitat de la UAB: sensibilitzacio, punts blaus i grups d'ajuda mutua" [Resources for promoting emotional wellbeing and self-care for the UAB community: awareness-raising, blue points, and mutual support groups].

September 17: The UAB to hold European Research Night with a full informative activities session

On Friday 26 September the UAB will celebrate European Research Night with a day full of informative activities. The aim is to bring research, innovation, and their protagonists closer to audiences of all ages in a simple and fun way. Starting at 5:00 p.m., the Universitat Autonoma de Barcelona will host a research fair featuring workshops and exhibitions, games, and mini-lectures with researchers from the university and research institutes from the UAB Sphere.

The event is held each year on the last Friday of September in more than 300 cities in 30 European countries simultaneously. During the week of 22 to 26 September, more than 200 activities will be offered in Catalonia, free of charge and for all audiences, including talks, workshops, experiments, shows, and games, with the participation of researchers from more than 50 scientific institutions.

Source: Company Website

urn:contentItem:6GTT-G873-RT4H-X1S6-00000-00Updated: September 19, 2025: More intercity buses to take you to the UAB and other recent news2025-09-25T00:00:00Z2025-11-15T07:40:49ZLexisNexisANNOUNCEMENTSUpdated: September 19, 2025: More intercity buses to take you to the UAB and other recent news

This year, the intercity bus routes connecting with the UAB will add almost 90 new departures. This affects the Barcelona-Cerdanyola-UAB, Sabadell-Barbera-Badia-UAB, Mataro-Argentona-UAB, Igualada-Martorell-UAB, and Montcada-Ripollet-UAB lines. These improvements are part of the Intercity Bus Emergency Plan, which receives an investment of EUR17 million. Bus a l'eix central de la UAB

On 19 September, UAB Rector Javier Lafuente was accompanied by Xavier Gabarrell, vice-rector for Campus and Sustainability, and Manel Nadal, secretary for Mobility and Infrastructure of the Government of Catalonia, at the presentation of the improvements for this 2025/26 academic year, which included almost 90 new departures of several intercity buses connecting the nearby towns with the UAB.

September 22: Events Calendar: The UAB to host the First Artistic Heritage Campus Research Conference

On 2 October the Periodicals Room of the Humanities Library, located in the Faculty of Arts & Humanities, will host the First Artistic Heritage Campus Research Conference, a meeting aimed at strengthening ties between the academic world and museum and heritage institutions. Imatge del cartell de la I Jornada del Campus de Patrimoni Artistic de la UAB

The main goal of the conference is to promote synergies between the University and the organisations making up this network, inviting participating institutions to present their ongoing research projects and propose new lines of research related to the collections, which could be developed in the final degree projects (TFG) and final master theses (TFM) of the studies linked to the Campus.

Source: Company Website

September 17: The UAB Healthcare Service celebrates its 50th anniversary with a tribute and recognition ceremony

The event, which brought together some one hundred people, was presided by UAB Rector Javier Lafuente, accompanied at the table by Secretary General Esther Zapater, and director of the SAS, Arantza Igartua.

Rector Lafuente welcomed the attendees and emphasised the importance of highlighting the service's track record. Esther Zapater then spoke about the fact that the SAS has been able to adapt to changing times over the course of five decades, incorporating specialties such as gynaecology, dentistry, occupational health and psychology, and demonstrating its ability to respond to critical moments such as the pandemic. The secretary general highlighted the role of proximity and humanity played by the service's staff and also gave thanks to the work carried out by the members of the First Response Teams in Emergency Situations (EPAS), who altruistically and voluntarily assist with first aid in the different UAB centres.

Source: Company Website

September 22: Autonomous University of Barcelona: Flu vaccination campaign begins

From 13 October to 10 December, the UAB Healthcare Service will be running a flu vaccination campaign for the entire university community. vacunaciogrip2017

From 13 October to 10 December, the university community will be able to receive the flu vaccine administered by the UAB Healthcare Service. The vaccination campaign is available to the entire university community, especially those at high risk of complications related to the flu.

Source: Company Website

September 19: Autonomous University of Barcelona First case of betanodavirus infection in a grouper confirmed in Catalonia in 2025

On 7 September a specimen of grouper (Epinephelus marginatus) was detected in waters near Barcelona with clear symptoms consistent with betanodavirus infection, also known as viral nervous necrosis (VNN). The discovery was made possible thanks to a report from a member of the Barcelona Underwater Fishing Association (APS), who sent the specimen to the Fish Pathology Diagnostic Service at the Universitat Autonoma de Barcelona (UAB). Samples of the fish were then sent to the European reference laboratory for this disease, where molecular techniques (qPCR) confirmed a very high presence of the virus in the animal's brain.

This identification, together with other reports of dead or symptomatic groupers, unequivocally confirms the spread of VNN and its presence in the coastal waters of Catalonia. For several years now, this betanodavirus has been causing outbreaks of mortality in groupers and other fish species throughout the Mediterranean, with particularly severe outbreaks in Greece, southern Italy, Spain, and recently in the Azores. In Spain, this virus had already caused outbreaks in the Balearic Islands, and a few years ago outbreaks were detected on the coast of the peninsula, with a progressive advance northwards causing very significant mortality of groupers in nature reserves such as Cabrera and Columbretes.

September 19: Autonomous University of Barcelona: Sign up and join a university volunteering programme

This new academic year experience the UAB in a different and more enriching manner. The Fundacio Autonoma Solidaria presents its volunteering programme for this year, which includes social, environmental, and health care programmes, with activities in prisons, hospitals, schools and on campus. All of these programmes work for peace, equality, sustainability and global justice. Volunteering is a unique opportunity to meet people, learn, contribute to social transformations, and validate credits. voluntariat FAS UAB

The Fundacio Autonoma Solidaria (FAS), an association with over 25 years of experience in university social actions, presents it catalogue of volunteering proposals for this 2025/26 academic year.

All members of the community can take part in university volunteering. Last year, more than 400 people volunteered, a unique initiative at the university with an enormous social value in terms of proximity and a tool for real transformation.

September 19: Autonomous University of Barcelona: First case of betanodavirus infection in a grouper confirmed in Catalonia in 2025

Thanks to citizen collaboration, on 7 September a grouper with symptoms of betanodavirus infection was detected in waters near Barcelona, diagnosed by the UAB Fish Pathology Diagnostic Service. For several years, the virus has been causing outbreaks of mortality in groupers and other fish species throughout the Mediterranean. The UAB and the Institute of Marine Sciences (ICM-CSIC) have set up an alert and sample collection network to identify cases and monitor the evolution of the disease. Mero

September 18: The UAB brings together leading experts in space communications in Barcelona

On 22 and 23 September, Casa Convalescencia UAB will host the Satellite Network of Experts V Seasonal School, with the participation of leading experts in satellite and space communications such as Holly Ridings from NASA and Oana Graur from ESA. Satellits

The Quantum Communication and Secure Information (Q-CSI) research group, from the Department of Telecommunications and Systems Engineering at the UAB, organises the EURASIP Satellite Network of Experts V Seasonal School, a project of the European Space Agency (ESA) within the framework of the Connectivity and Secure Communications (CSC) department, co-organised by the Institute of Space Studies of Catalonia (IEEC).

The school is aimed at early-stage researchers and industry professionals, PhD students, and postdoctoral researchers interested in exploring the latest advances in satellite and space communications. It will take place on 22 and 23 Septemeber at Casa Convalescencia UAB and is organised in conjunction with the International Conference on Satellite Systems Communications (ICSSC 2025) of the American Institute of Aeronautics and Astronautics (AIAA), which will take place from 23 to 25 September.

Source: Company Website

September 18: Autonomous University of Barcelona Horses, possible allies in forest fire prevention

The research-which included the participation of Boumort Wildland, the Miranda Foundation, the Forest Horses association, and the University of Barcelona (UB)-reveals that horses adapt their diet according to breed, environment and use. This flexibility helps them play a complementary role alongside other herbivores in sustainable fire prevention strategies, given that their grazing reduces fuel loads and maintains open landscapes. The study was co-authored by researchers from the Department of Animal and Food Science at the UAB Jordi Bartolome and Araceli Gort-Esteve.

"Until now research on extensive herding and forest fire prevention has focused mainly on sheep and goats, with some isolated studies done on breeds of rustic cattle. There have been very few studies on horses within this context, since traditionally they are classified as plant grazers that have little effect on woody vegetations", explains Ariadna Nieto-Espinet, Ramon y Cajal researcher at the UdL and zooarchaeologist. "Our work is one of the first to use empirical data to analyse their potential in forest management in the Mediterannean", she adds.

Source: Company Website

September 18: Join the October edition of the UAB's virtual fair for Master's Degrees, Graduate Courses and PhD Programmes

Are you looking into master's degrees and graduate courses to continue your training, specialise or reorient your professional career? Have you finished a master's degree and want to continue your academic career with a PhD? Would you like to meet and speak with the coordinator(s) of the programme that interests you? The UAB's Virtual Fair for Master's Degrees, Graduate Courses and PhD Programmes celebrates a new edition so that you can find the answers to all those questions and more. We invite you to check the complete list of sessions and register for all those that are of interest to you.

From Monday 6 to Friday 10 October 2025: five days in a row to be able to receive information about a wide range of official master's degrees, UAB-specific master's degrees, graduate courses and PhD programmes in all areas of knowledge. Around 150 information sessions, each focused on a specific study programme. The sessions consist of a short introduction made by the coordinator(s) of the study programme and then a question and answer session to clear up any doubts you may have.

Source: Company Website

September 18: Barcelona already has its first cycling map

The study is the result of a collaboration between the Institute of Environmental Science and Technology (ICTA-UAB) the Barcelona Supercomputing Center (BSC-CNS) and the Bicycle Club of Catalonia (BACC), with the fundamental support of the public: 43 volunteers collected data through the BiciZen platform, making a more detailed and possible model possible.

It is an innovative tool that allows estimating cycling traffic in more than 20,000 road sections of the city and that opens the door to a much more accurate understanding of cycling mobility patterns.

This information is key to the management of mobility in the city, since for the first time we have a detailed x-ray of cycling flows at street level. In addition, one of the great lessons learned from the project is that citizen participation has been decisive in improving the models: without crowdsourcing, today we would not have such a fine-tuned and representative map of the cycling reality.

Source: Company Website

September 18: The UAB is sad to announce the death of Josep Llopart

Josep Llopart Barcelo held the position of university manager before continuing his professional career outside the UAB.

The wake will be held at the Molins de Rei funeral home on 18 September until 2:00 p.m. The funeral service will take place at 3:30 p.m. at the Sant Miquel Arcangel church in Molins de Rei on the same day, 18 September.

The UAB extends its heartfelt condolences to those who knew him and expresses its sadness for losing a member of its community.

September 18: Sixty-four internships to explain the UAB to future UABers

If you are a UAB student and want to share your experience with others, this is your chance! We are looking for 64 undergraduate and graduate students interested in explaining the different degrees and services offered at the UAB and solve any doubts future UABers may have.

We offer three different internships, one with 60 places and two more with two places each:

The first is the Promotional activities which consists in 100 hours distributed throughout the months of January and May 2026, and focusing on student participation in activities and events, such as the Education Fair, Open Days, Family Days and other activities, both on-site and online. All of the activities can be found at the #VisitTheUAB website. Students will receive a grant of 746 euros gross in total. A total of 60 placements are offered to students from all faculties and schools, to be able to explain the wide range of academic programmes available at the UAB. You must sign up through Nexus.

September 17: Autonomous University of Barcelona One more person from Palestine benefits from the #UABRefugi grants

A PhD student from Palestine will join the UAB in the 2025/26 academic year thanks to the #UABRefugi grants. The grants represent a comprehensive support model for refugees and now has been reinforced with a special fund to assist university students currently suffering from the armed conflict and genocide being committed by the Israeli state against the Palestinian population. A total of five people have already benefited from this aid.

The UAB programme is a comprehensive support model since the grants cover not only academic expenses, but also other costs related to materials and transport. The UAB also provides support to refugees, such as in the case of the new PhD student arriving from Palestine and his family, in terms of housing, either by reserving places at the Vila Universitaria or by working in coordination with the municipalities surrounding the campus. In addition, the UAB will launch a crowdfunding campaign among the university community to obtain new resources to support extra-academic needs such as legal advice, document translation, etc.

Source: Company Website

September 17: Autonomous University of Barcelona La Comunitaria to mark the start of the new academic year once again

On Tuesday 30 September, The Community returns for a new fall edition, from 12:00 noon to 4:00 p.m. The Bellaterra campus will host activities, shows, experiences, and much more. The event is an opportunity to get to know the UAB's network of associations, learn, and enjoy a unique day.

The opening speech, in the Placa del Coneixement, will kick off the 2025 fall edition of La Comunitaria. And once the day begins, attendees will be able to enjoy the entites' fair which offers a wide range of activities organised by the different groups, student councils, and services that form part of the University and enrich the UAB.

In addition, Placa del Coneixement will host various shows and performances, such as the traditional human towers by the Ganapies and sardana dancing by the Agrupacio Sardanista de Cerdanyola del Valles. It should be noted that this year's event coincides with the 25th anniversary of the UAB Solidarity Foundation (FAS), with activities to commemorate the anniversary.

Source: Company Website

September 17: Twelve UAB projects selected to study and improve emotional wellbeing at universities

Twelve UAB research projects have been selected by AGAUR in a second call for the development of projects with social impacts. The projects must take on challenges related to mental health and emotional wellbeing at universities and other entities of the research and innovation system.

The selected projects cover disciplines such as clinical and health psychology, veterinary medicine, physics, nursing, social psychology, and anthropology, and will address different subjects of study. The aim is to obtain data and provide solutions for the emotional wellbeing of all members of the university community, which in turn can be extrapolated and sustained over time. The total amount obtained to conduct these studies is EUR220,000.

All selected studies will be carried out in coordination between the research groups involved, with the collaboration of the UAB's CORE in Mental Health network and the Equality and Diversity Service. The main project will be carried out by the Equality and Diversity Service, under the title "Recursos per a la promocio del benestar emocional i l'autocura per a la comunitat de la UAB: sensibilitzacio, punts blaus i grups d'ajuda mutua" [Resources for promoting emotional wellbeing and self-care for the UAB community: awareness-raising, blue points, and mutual support groups].

September 17: The UAB to hold European Research Night with a full informative activities session

On Friday 26 September the UAB will celebrate European Research Night with a day full of informative activities. The aim is to bring research, innovation, and their protagonists closer to audiences of all ages in a simple and fun way. Starting at 5:00 p.m., the Universitat Autonoma de Barcelona will host a research fair featuring workshops and exhibitions, games, and mini-lectures with researchers from the university and research institutes from the UAB Sphere.

The event is held each year on the last Friday of September in more than 300 cities in 30 European countries simultaneously. During the week of 22 to 26 September, more than 200 activities will be offered in Catalonia, free of charge and for all audiences, including talks, workshops, experiments, shows, and games, with the participation of researchers from more than 50 scientific institutions.

Source: Company Website
